article.headline: Alabama 79, Charlotte 72
article.story: TUSCALOOSA, Ala. (AP) -- Earnest Shelton scored 22 points and Antoine Pettway added 13, all in the second half, to help Alabama hold off Charlotte 79-72 on Wednesday night. Kennedy Winston added 11 points and Chuck Davis had 10 points and 10 rebounds for Alabama (3-2), which blew a 15-point lead. Brendan Plavich hit five 3-pointers and had 17 points for Charlotte (3-2), which came into the game averaging 91.5 points per game but was held to its lowest total of the season. Demon Brown added 17 points, and Curtis Withers had 10 points and seven rebounds. The Crimson Tide led 32-17 with 1:50 to play before halftime, but Charlotte closed out the half on a 7-0 run. The 49ers also scored the first seven points of the second half, pulling within 32-31 on a fastbreak layup by Brown. Alabama stretched its lead to 43-35 on a field goal by Emmett Thomas with 15:27 to play. But eight minutes later the 49ers took a 60-59 lead on a 3-pointer by Brown, their first lead since 3-2. Plavich hit a 3 to tie the game at 66-66 but missed the foul shot. Charlotte still managed to lead 68-66 on a dunk by Martin Iti at the 3:49 mark. Alabama regained the lead for good on back-to-back 3s by Pettway. Mitchell Baldwin hit a layup to pull Charlotte within 75-72, but Pettway made four free throws in the final 10 seconds to ice the game. The loss snapped a three-game winning streak for Charlotte, including a 96-92 win at defending NCAA champion Syracuse.
